intro: Bursaria lasiophylla var. albicoma, commonly known as the white-leaf bursaria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves that are typically pale green to white in color. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found in sandy or rocky soils. It is a low-growing shrub that thrives in dry, coastal environments and is adapted to withstand salt spray and arid conditions. Bursaria lasiophylla var. albicoma plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes and provides habitat for various invertebrates.
